comments:
This might be a configuration issue.  I added the eclipse bugzilla repository.  I created a repository task.  Ooops!  I didn't have MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME set.  I set that, then restarted Eclipse/Mylar.  I clicked on my bugzilla task (bug 157700), and got an error.

I did a save, but that apparently didn't create the bug -- I don't know where it went (I'll file a separate bug on that), so I tried again to click on the bug 157700, and got the following in my .log file:

org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /.autofs/homes/ubccshome/d/duckys/src/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/47/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3232.so: libxpcom.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory)

Disabling the internal browser from Window->Preferences->Mylar->Task pane (as per the FAQ) made the error go away.

The mentioned FAQ entry: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Installing_on_Linux


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 152868 ***
